        public Calculator()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main thread, initialize the application
        Parameters:
        args - args are unused

      • printInfo

        public static void printInfo()
        Show in window the information about calculator: patterns for the operations and some examples. This method use System class to print the info.

      • readMode

        public static int readMode(java.util.Scanner sc)
        Reads the mode for calculator from input channel, verifying inputs and doing a loop while user doesn't type a correct value, showing warning or errors messages in console when an incorrect value is typed.
        Parameters:
        sc - the input channel of the calculator. sc != null. Input channel must not be closed.
        Returns:
        mode:int, which represents the typed mode by user.

      • start

        public static void start(int mode,
                         java.util.Scanner sc)
        Start the calculator, initializing the memory {Array:int of length 10} and memoryPointers. This methods attends saved memory [save each result in memory, using saveResult(double[], int, String) method], printing also the results of each operation. For operation, this method use readAndOperate(Scanner, double[]) method which returns an String value which contains the operation's result typed by the user. This String must be validated as or error before //TODO:.
        Parameters:
        mode - refers to mode of the application: 0 mode refers a single-operation calculator, but 1 mode to a multi-operation calculator. Start method is in a loop while mode 1 is actived. Mode must be 0 or 1
        sc - the input channel of the calculator. sc != null. Input channel must not be closed.

      • saveResult

        public static int saveResult(double[] memory,
                             int memoryPointer,
                             java.lang.String strResult)
        Allows to save a real [double] number in memory, inserting the result in the given pointer, And returning the next free space. When there are not more space, the returned pointer must point to init of the memory. This method, also, doesn't save Nan or Errors and converts strResults in double from binary,hexadecimal or decimal conversion or scientist notation (calling getValueOfScientificNotation(String))

        Pre:

        memory has already been initalized as array of 10 positions.
        Parameters:
        memory - represents the memory of program. Must be an array of doubles. memory != null
        memoryPointer - represents the current free space in memory to save a number. memoryPointer >= 0 and memoryPointer < memory.length.
        strResult - represents the result that will be saved in memory. result must not empty or null And must not be a calculator's error. And if the parameter represents a value of an conversion, must be use one of the patterns presented on the calculator's info.
        Returns:
        An int which represents the new pointer which points a current free space in memory.

      • getValueOfScientificNotation

        public static double getValueOfScientificNotation(java.lang.String notation)
        Return a double from a scientific notation string which use the scientis notation pattern of this calculator ({number}x10to{base}). Using String split function, converts {number} to double and {base} to Integer and multiply {number} by 10 {base} times.
        Parameters:
        notation - Represents the number in Scientific notation (with the pattern of this calculator app). notation must not be empty or null
        Returns:
        A double value which contains the real value of scientific notation

      • wait

        public static boolean wait(int mode)
        Returns true if calculator's mode != 0 or false at instead.
        Parameters:
        mode - represents the current calculator's mode. mode must be either 0 or 1.
        Returns:
        A boolean value which represents if the calculators must wait another operation of the user.

      • getLastResult

        public static double getLastResult(double[] memory,
                                   int memoryPointer)
        Returns the last number saved in memory. If it is in 0-indexed space, then the returned value will be the last-indexed number in memory, so, the number at the last index [memory.length-1] will be returned.
        Parameters:
        memory - represents the memory of calculator. memory != null and memory must be an array of doubles
        memoryPointer - represents the current pointer to free space in memory. memoryPointer >= 0 and memoryPointer < memory.length-1
        Returns:
        A double which represents the number saved as last result in memory.

      • readAndOperate

        public static java.lang.String readAndOperate(java.util.Scanner sc,
                                              double[] memory)
        Reads the first number or instruction typed by user, to decide the next step in the calculation {view printInfo method}. Evaluating if the line typed refers to a number, non base-10 number or a memory access, then, do the correct action and call doNumberOperation method to continue with operation.
        Parameters:
        sc - Input channel of application
        memory - Memory:Array:double of application, used for accessing of memory-saved numbers
        Returns:
        A String which contains the result of the operation or an error message if the operation could not be realized.

      • isANumber

        public static boolean isANumber(java.lang.String line)
        This method evalueate if the line is a number, verifying if the line is empty or if the first character if - or each character is a digit.
        Parameters:
        line - Represents the line which will be evaluated. Line must not be null
        Returns:
        As a boolean value which turns on True if the line represents a number of false instead

      • getNonDecimalNumber

        public static double getNonDecimalNumber(java.lang.String line)
        Returns a line as the double number which represents, for example, if line = 'A', this method returns 10, or if line = 'Pi' will return 3,141516....

        pre:

        Line must was validated by isNonDecimalNumber(String) method before this method call.
        Parameters:
        line - represents an hexadecimal value or Pi. line != null, line.length >=0, line is not empty.
        Returns:
        A real number, which value of line or -1 if line is an incorrect value.

      • isNonDecimalNumber

        public static boolean isNonDecimalNumber(java.lang.String line)
        Verify if a line is a simple hexadecimal value (e.g. ABC12, A1, D3, E3, 10, AF or 1-9) or if is the Pi number
        Parameters:
        line - the line that will be validated. line != null. line must not be empty. line.lenght>0
        Returns:
        True if the lowered-case line is equals to either a, b, c, d, e, f or 'pi'. False at instead.

      • getMemoryAccess

        public static java.lang.String getMemoryAccess(java.lang.String line,
                                               double[] memory)
        Get a value saved in memory using the line passed as parameter.

        Example

        For example if the line is equals to mem5 represents the 5th result saved in memory.

        Pre:

        Memory has been initialized and contains not null values.
        Parameters:
        line - represents the access to memory. line must not be null and must not be empty. also, line must be use the patter presented in calculator's info and must be represents and index between 0 and memory.length
        memory - represents the calculator's memory. It must not be null.
        Returns:
        As string the value saved in the memory.

      • isMemoryAccess

        public static boolean isMemoryAccess(java.lang.String line)
        Verify if the line contains the 'mem' command, used for memory access.
        Parameters:
        line - represents the command to access to memory. line != null and line must not be empty- The line must be use the mem access pattern presented at calculator's info
        Returns:
        A boolean value which is True if the line contains the 'mem' command or False instead.

      • doNumberOperation

        public static java.lang.String doNumberOperation(java.util.Scanner sc,
                                                 java.lang.String line,
                                                 double[] memory)
        Read the next input from user, which represents the operation to do. Then, use the inOperation(double, String, Scanner, double[]) Method to do the operation and return its result.

        Pre:

        Memory has already been initialized.
        Parameters:
        sc - represents the scanner of the program. It is the input stream. sc must not be null and its stream must be open.
        line - represents the last line read
        memory - Represents the memory of the calculator. Memory must not be null and memory.length == 10
        Returns:
        An String which contains the result of operation

      • inOperation

        public static java.lang.String inOperation(double number,
                                           java.lang.String operation,
                                           java.util.Scanner sc,
                                           double[] memory)
        This method evaluate if the operation passed as parameter is an one-number operation or not, then if the operation is a one-number operation call the correct calculus function with the parameters, but else, read the nextNumber and calls doOperate(double, String, double) to execute a two-number operation.

        Pre:

        memory has already been initialized.
        Parameters:
        number - Represents the first number to operate. number must not be NaN
        operation - Represents the selected operation by the user. operation must not be null or empty
        sc - Represents the scanner (input stream of the program). sc's stream must not be closed
        memory - Represents the memory of the app. memory must not be null and memory.length ==10
        Returns:
        The result of the selected operation as String.

      • doOperate

        public static java.lang.String doOperate(double number,
                                         java.lang.String operation,
                                         double number2)
        This method allows to do a two-number operation. With selected operation this method do operations as: sum, multiplication, subtraction, module, division. or do operations as: baseExchange (calling baseExchange(double, double)), nlog and nth-square (calling nLog(double, double) and nthSquare(double, double))
        Parameters:
        number - Represents the first number to operate. number must be a double, number must not be nan.
        operation - Represents a two-number operation from the calculators info. operation must not be null or empty
        number2 - Represents the second numbert to operate. number must be a double, number must not be nan.
        Returns:
        An string which contain the result of the operation

      • sqrt

        public static double sqrt(double number)
        Find the sqrt of a number using the formula: sqrt = ( (sqrt/2)+(number/sqrt/2) ) / 2
        Parameters:
        number - Represents the number. number must be a double and not be Nan.
        Returns:
        A double value which represents the sqrt

      • pow

        public static double pow(double number,
                         double power)
        Do a pow operation, multiplying the number by it-self power times

        Pre:

        Params must be double values and must not be Nan
        Parameters:
        number - Represents the number which will be pow
        power - Represents the exponent of the number. power must be >=0
        Returns:
        A double which contain the pow result

      • factorial

        public static double factorial(double number)
        This method do factorial operation, using the number parameter. Returns 1 if number ==1 || number == 0 or return 0 if number < 0.
        Parameters:
        number - Represents the number. number must be a double value and mustn't be nan.
        Returns:
        A double value which contains the factorial result.

      • baseExchange

        public static java.lang.String baseExchange(double number,
                                            double base)
        This method do a base exchange operation using binaryConversion(double) and hexadecimalConversion(double) allowing to converts to binary or hexadecimal number.
        Parameters:
        number - Which will be converted. mumber must be a double and must not be NaN. number must be in decimal base
        base - Represents the base used for convertion. Must be a double value of 2 or 16.
        Returns:
        The result as String.

      • binaryConversion

        public static java.lang.String binaryConversion(double number)
        This method converts a number in its binary representation using its residues by 2
        Parameters:
        number - Represents base-10 number. Must be a double number and must not be NaN.
        Returns:
        An String which contains the result.

      • tenBaseConversion

        public static double tenBaseConversion(java.lang.String number,
                                       int base)
        Converts a base-{base} number to a base-10 number. Only works with binary or hexadecimal numbers. This method works calculating the distance of each string's character from '0' or 'A' (for hexadecimal numbers) and in last case aproximate adding 10 for the distance. Then calculating with this value the pow with current exp.
        Parameters:
        number - Represents the number which will be converted. number must be a double value and number>=0. This param must not be a NaN
        base - Represents the current base of the number. Must be an integer value. Must be only 2 or 16
        Returns:
        A double which contains the base-10 result.

      • hexadecimalConversion

        public static java.lang.String hexadecimalConversion(double number)
        This method converts a number in its binary representation using its residues by 16
        Parameters:
        number - Represents base-10 number. Must be a double number and must not be NaN.
        Returns:
        An String which contains the result.

      • toScientificNotation

        public static java.lang.String toScientificNotation(double number)
        Converts to Scientific Notation a base-10 number, using the commaIndex as reference to get the number's Scientific notation.
        Parameters:
        number - Represents the number which will be converted. number must be a double value and must not be NaN.
        Returns:
        An String which contains the scientific notation with patter: {number}x10to{exp}

      • toRadian

        public static double toRadian(double number)
        Converts a number to radians (using Math.toRadians(double))
        Parameters:
        number - Represents the number which will be converted, number must be a double value and must not be NaN
        Returns:
        A double which contains the number in radians.

      • toDegree

        public static double toDegree(double number)
        Converts a number to degree (using Math.toDegrees(double))
        Parameters:
        number - Represents the number which will be converted, number must be a double value and must not be NaN
        Returns:
        A double which contains the number in degrees.

      • sin

        public static double sin(double number)
        Calculate the sin of a number (in degrees) using Math.sin(double)
        Parameters:
        number - Represents the number for which the sine is calculated, number must be a double value and must not be NaN
        Returns:
        A double which contains the sine of the number.

      • cos

        public static double cos(double number)
        Calculate the sin of a number (in degrees) using Math.cos(double)
        Parameters:
        number - Represents the number for which the cosine is calculated, number must be a double value and must not be NaN
        Returns:
        A double which contains the cosine of the number.

      • tan

        public static double tan(double number)
        Calculates the tangent of a given number. Using sin(double) and cos(double). Then do sin/cos operaton.
        Parameters:
        number - Represents the number for which tanget will be calculated. number must be a double and must not be NaN.
        Returns:
        A double which contains the number's tangent.

      • log

        public static double log(double number)
        Calculates the base-10 logarithm of a given number. Using Math.log10(double).
        Parameters:
        number - Represents the number for which base-10 logarithm will be calculated. number must be a double and must not be NaN.
        Returns:
        A double which contains the number's base-10 logarithm.

      • nLog

        public static double nLog(double number,
                          double n)
        Calculates the base-n logarithm of a given number. Using log(double) and the logarithm base exchange property.
        Parameters:
        number - Represents the number for which base-n logarithm will be calculated. number must be a double and must not be NaN.
        n - Represents the n of the logartihm. n must be a double and must not be NaN. number >=0
        Returns:
        A double which contains the number's base-n logarithm.

      • nthSquare

        public static double nthSquare(double base,
                               double n)
        Calculates the nthSquare of a number using Math.pow(double, double), Math.E and Math.log(double) with the property: euler^(log(n)/n);
        Parameters:
        base - Represents the number for which nth-square will be calculated. base must be a double and must not be NaN.
        n - Represents the n of the square, must be a double and must not be NaN.
        Returns:
        A double value which cointains the n-th square of the given number.
